channel.title: Thanks to the double XP weekend
channel.description:
[IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/2n1idzr.png[/img]
Got my second 99, managed to hit 99 mining and trim my Wc cape :p and made around 50m, have 145k gold ore banked, 32k coal, should i smith it all and craft the bracelets? or sell all the ore.

item.title: Thanks to the double XP weekend
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

[quote=“Runescape-Xperia, post:7, topic:414735”][quote author=`Aaron link=topic=516695.msg3751683#msg3751683 date=1316068768]
managed to hit 99 mining
[/quote]
What did you mine, and where did you mine at.[/quote]

I did a lot of ore at the mining guild, and power mining iron. And at 90 i did LRC.

Read full topic

item.title: Thanks to the double XP weekend
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

If you smelt them with goldsmithing gloves, you’ll get about 8m experience. Making bracelets right away will give you 3.625m crafting experience. I just recently did 50k gold bracelets, so I know how that is. Took be about two weeks while multitasking. If you go solid, it’ll take about 6-8 weeks, which starts to bring up the question of whether it’s worth it.

For me, the 50k was worth it. I purchased the 50k ore, smelted and crafted at the same time, then sold the 50k bracelets to the rogue and barely lost any money. But for 150k gold, it’s worth it to just sell it, smelt & smith adamant bolts at the blast furnace, and craft battlestaves for crafting. The experience rates for gold bracelets are too low to be considerable for long-term training.

Read full topic
item.source: Thanks to the double XP weekend
